intro: Cienfuegosia heterophylla var. cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cienfuegosia, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for cultivation in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
